alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades; Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; John Day Basin; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 09 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT AND RAIN... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will see rises through the first half the week. A weather system is bringing precipitation to the Pacific Northwest this afternoon with rain expected to increase in coverage Sunday night and Monday, especially in the mountains. The heaviest and most widespread rain is forecast to persist through Tuesday morning with lighter showers thereafter. Uncertainty remains regarding the precise location of a band of moderate to heavy precipitation along and ahead of a cold frontal boundary Monday afternoon into Tuesday morning across eastern Oregon and eastern Washington. Currently, only a few gauges are expected to approach bankfull. As of now, flooding is not expected to occur with this round of rainfall over the next several days. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Monday morning with the latest updates to the forecast.
